Title: Date And Time Functions
Description: The unixepoch(time-value, modifier, modifier, ...) function returns the Unix timestamp - the number of seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC. It accepts a time-value and zero or more modifiers.
Returns: An integer or floating point number representing the Unix timestamp.
Examples: SELECT unixepoch(); -- Returns the current Unix timestamp.
SELECT unixepoch('2024-08-21 14:16:00'); -- Returns the Unix timestamp for August 21, 2024, 14:16:00.
SELECT unixepoch('now', 'subsec'); -- Returns the Unix timestamp with millisecond precision.
